Introduction
Pasi Sihvonen currently works as head of the Entomology team at the Finnish Museum of Natural History at the University of Helsinki. Pasi's research focuses on phylogeny, taxonomy, and conservation issues on the Geometrid moths in global context. Ongoing co-authored projects include Geometrid Moths of Europe vol. 6 (monograph), revisionary work on African geometrids and molecular phylogeny of the Geometroid moths.

Lepidoptera Iranica
Project
The project aims to compile all knowledge related to Lepidoptera of Iran and its neighbour countries.

Geometrid Moths of Europe, volume 6
Project
Revision of European Ennominae moths, covering 202 species in 30 colour plates. Comprehensive text and rich illustration of structures for all species. Four new species are described, 140+ taxonomic changes are proposed and systematic checklist for entire European and adjacent regions' Geometridae fauna is provided. Multi-authored monograph is planned to come out in summer 2019.
